page.title: 12Linslade-A Commuter Town
page.content: At about eight o'clock in the morning some people are getting on the train to go to London to work. Most commuters get on the fast line trains. Most of Linslade was built around the railway, which was built in the eighteen hundreds. Many people who work in London commute from Linslade. Some people cycle, drive or walk from their homes to the station. There are trains from Linslade to London every half hour, but in peak times there are more. The fastest trains to London from here take 35 minutes but the slow ones take about 55 minutes. The reason why workers live here is because they don't want to live in a large, bustling city with lots of noise. Also, if you move about ten miles nearer to London, the price of houses goes up about ten thousand pounds.
